definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Some are asymptomatic and discovered as an incidental radiologic finding.
sentences.chinese: 這些病人僅在偶然的放射線檢查時才被發現。

sentences.english: After extensive radiology treatment for throat cancer, Zhang Xinmei has been left weak and frail.
sentences.chinese: 接受放射線治療鼻咽癌之後，張馨鎂變得非常虛弱。

sentences.english: Radiation Sniper SlugsTechnology is getting better each day.
sentences.chinese: 放射線狙擊兵芯塊技術正在變得比較每個日子。

sentences.english: A barium aluminate concrete and fancy face brick are used for radioactive rays shielding protection.
sentences.chinese: 用於放射線屏敝防護的鋇鋁酸鹽混凝土及其裝飾面磚。

sentences.english: She convinced the government to empower her to set up France's first military radiology centers.
sentences.chinese: 她堅信政府會讓她建立法國第一個軍用放射線學中心。

sentences.english: Radiological findings and clinical data are presented for the two cases.
sentences.chinese: 放射線學與臨牀表徵一併呈現。

sentences.english: In the pig model, about 65% of the BPA diffused through the skin.
sentences.chinese: 滲透豬耳朵皮膚的放射線活動。

sentences.english: The body cannot tolerate such large amounts of radiation.
sentences.chinese: 身體經不住那麼大劑量的放射線。

definition: (medical) compensation/to repay a debt or obligation in place of someone else
